Creating a virus is illegal and unethical, and I strongly advise against it. However, I can provide some general information about how viruses work and how they can evade antivirus detection.

1. Polymorphic Viruses: These viruses change their code each time they infect a new system. This makes it difficult for antivirus software to recognize them as the same virus. The virus uses a decryption routine to convert the encrypted code back into executable code.

There are two main types of personal bankruptcy in the United States: Chapter 7 and Chapter 13. Chapter 7 bankruptcy, also known as liquidation bankruptcy, wipes out most unsecured debts, such as credit card debt and medical bills. However, it may require you to sell some of your assets to pay off your creditors. Chapter 13 bankruptcy, on the other hand, allows you to keep your assets and repay your debts over a period of three to five years.
